page.title: 05The A92 Stonehaven Bypass
page.content: and rock. Two flyovers and three major bridges had to be built. After the opening of the bypass in Nov. 84 there were complaints. Shopkeepers were woried about falling trade. Garages too for falling Petrol Sales. Fears were expressed about Stonehaven's Tourist trade. Would it benefit or loose with the bypass? But now as cars, lorries, busses, vans all bypass Stonehaven it is difficult to imagine that at one time up to 12000 vehicles a day passed along Dunnotar Avenue and Allardyce street. Stonehaven still bussels with trade. It is still dificult to park your car on a Saturday morning. Trade seems brisk. But gone are the smells and vibrations of the juggernauts and gone are the long waits of several minutes to cross the road.
